pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:0.4.eng: The training rule on renouncing the training

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.1.comm: The nuns’ offenses entailing suspension 7, 8, and 9 are identical to the monks’ suspension 5 Bu Ss 5:2.2.13.1, 8 Bu Ss 8:1.9.32.1, and 9 Bu Ss 9:1.2.14.1 respectively.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ bhaṇḍitvā kupitā anattamanā evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.2.eng: the nun Caṇḍakāḷī had argued with the nuns. In anger she said this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.3.pli: “buddhaṃ paccācikkhāmi, dhammaṃ paccācikkhāmi, saṅghaṃ paccācikkhāmi, sikkhaṃ paccācikkhāmi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.3.eng: “I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training!

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.4.pli: Kinnumāva samaṇiyo yā samaṇiyo sakyadhītaro, santaññāpi samaṇiyo lajjiniyo kukkuccikā sikkhākāmā tāsāhaṃ santike brahmacariyaṃ carissāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.4.eng: The Sakyan daughters are not the only monastics. There are other monastics who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. I’ll practice the spiritual life with them.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.4.comm: According to Sp-ṭ 2.709 kinnumāva should be read as kiṁ nu imā eva. Kinnumāva samaṇiyo yā samaṇiyo sakyadhītaro might then be rendered quite literally as, “Those ascetics who are daughters of the Sakyan (yā samaṇiyo sakyadhītaro), why are just these ones ascetics (kinnumāva samaṇiyo)?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.5.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.5.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.6.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā caṇḍakāḷī kupitā anattamanā evaṃ vakkhati—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.6.eng: “How could the nun Caṇḍakāḷī say this in anger?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.8.pli: Kinnumāva samaṇiyo yā samaṇiyo sakyadhītaro, santaññāpi samaṇiyo lajjiniyo kukkuccikā sikkhākāmā tāsāhaṃ santike brahmacariyaṃ carissāmī’”ti …pe…

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī kupitā anattamanā evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Caṇḍakāḷī said this in anger?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.11.pli: Kinnumāva samaṇiyo yā samaṇiyo sakyadhītaro, santaññāpi samaṇiyo lajjiniyo kukkuccikā sikkhākāmā, tāsāhaṃ santike brahmacariyaṃ carissāmī’”ti?

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.14.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī kupitā anattamanā evaṃ vakkhati—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.14.eng: “How could the nun Caṇḍakāḷī say this in anger?

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.16.pli: Kinnumāva samaṇiyo yā samaṇiyo sakyadhītaro, santaññāpi samaṇiyo lajjiniyo kukkuccikā sikkhākāmā, tāsāhaṃ santike brahmacariyaṃ carissāmī’ti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.18.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.18.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.19.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī kupitā anattamanā evaṃ vadeyya—

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.20.pli: ‘buddhaṃ paccācikkhāmi, dhammaṃ paccācikkhāmi, saṅghaṃ paccācikkhāmi, sikkhaṃ paccācikkhāmi. Kinnumāva samaṇiyo yā samaṇiyo sakyadhītaro. Santaññāpi samaṇiyo lajjiniyo kukkuccikā sikkhākāmā, tāsāhaṃ santike brahmacariyaṃ carissāmī’ti,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.20.eng: “I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training! The Sakyan daughters are not the only monastics. There are other monastics who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. I’ll practice the spiritual life with them,”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.21.eng: then the nuns should correct her like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.22.pli: ‘māyye, kupitā anattamanā evaṃ avaca— buddhaṃ paccācikkhāmi, dhammaṃ paccācikkhāmi, saṅghaṃ paccācikkhāmi, sikkhaṃ paccācikkhāmi. Kinnumāva samaṇiyo yā samaṇiyo sakyadhītaro. Santaññāpi samaṇiyo lajjiniyo kukkuccikā sikkhākāmā, tāsāhaṃ santike brahmacariyaṃ carissāmīti, abhiramāyye, svākkhāto dhammo; cara brahmacariyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā’ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.22.eng: “Venerable, don’t say such things in anger, ‘I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training! The Sakyan daughters are not the only monastics. There are other monastics who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. I’ll practice the spiritual life with them.’ Take delight, Venerable; the Teaching is well proclaimed. Practice the spiritual life for the complete ending of suffering.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.23.pli: Evañca sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi vuccamānā tatheva paggaṇheyya, sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsitabbā tassa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.23.eng: If that nun continues as before, the nuns should press her up to three times to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.24.pli: Yāvatatiyañce samanubhāsīyamānā taṃ paṭinissajjeyya iccetaṃ kusalaṃ;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.24.eng: If she then stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.25.pli: no ce paṭinissajjeyya, ayampi bhikkhunī yāvatatiyakaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.25.eng: If she does not stop, then after the third announcement that nun too has committed an offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.8.pli: “buddhaṃ paccācikkhāmi …pe… sikkhaṃ paccācikkhāmi. Kinnumāva samaṇiyo yā samaṇiyo sakyadhītaro. Santaññāpi samaṇiyo lajjiniyo kukkuccikā sikkhākāmā, tāsāhaṃ santike brahmacariyaṃ carissāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.8.eng: “I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training! The Sakyan daughters are not the only monastics. There are other monastics who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. I’ll practice the spiritual life with them.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.12.pli: aññāhi bhikkhunīhi. Yā passanti yā suṇanti tāhi vattabbā—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.12.eng: other nuns who see it or hear about it. They should correct her like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.13.eng: “Venerable, don’t say such things in anger:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.14.eng: ‘I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training!

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.15.eng: The Sakyan daughters are not the only monastics.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.16.pli: Santaññāpi samaṇiyo lajjiniyo kukkuccikā sikkhākāmā, tāsāhaṃ santike brahmacariyaṃ carissāmī’ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.16.eng: There are other monastics who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. I’ll practice the spiritual life with them.’

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.17.eng: Take delight, Venerable; the Teaching is well proclaimed.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.18.eng: Practice the spiritual life for the complete ending of suffering.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.19.eng: And they should correct her a second

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.21.eng: If she stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.22.eng: If she does not stop, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.23.eng: If those who hear about it do not say anything, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.24.eng: That nun, even if she has to be pulled into the Sangha, should be corrected like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.25.eng: “Venerable, don’t say such things in anger:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.26.eng: ‘I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training!

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.27.eng: The Sakyan daughters are not the only monastics.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.28.pli: Santaññāpi samaṇiyo lajjiniyo kukkuccikā sikkhākāmā, tāsāhaṃ santike brahmacariyaṃ carissāmī’ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.28.eng: There are other monastics who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. I’ll practice the spiritual life with them.’

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.29.eng: Take delight, Venerable; the Teaching is well proclaimed.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.30.eng: Practice the spiritual life for the complete ending of suffering.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.31.eng: They should correct her a second

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.33.eng: If she stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.34.eng: If she does not stop, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.36.eng: “And, monks, she should be pressed like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.37.eng: A competent and capable nun should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.38.eng: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.39.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmā bhikkhunī kupitā anattamanā evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.39.eng: The nun so-and-so says this in anger:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.40.pli: ‘buddhaṃ paccācikkhāmi, dhammaṃ paccācikkhāmi, saṅghaṃ paccācikkhāmi, sikkhaṃ paccācikkhāmi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.40.eng: “I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training!

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.41.eng: The Sakyan daughters are not the only monastics.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.42.pli: Santaññāpi samaṇiyo lajjiniyo kukkuccikā sikkhākāmā tāsāhaṃ santike brahmacariyaṃ carissāmī’ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.42.eng: There are other monastics who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. I’ll practice the spiritual life with them.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.43.eng: And she keeps on saying it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.44.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuniṃ samanubhāseyya tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.44.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should press her to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.46.eng: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.47.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmā bhikkhunī kupitā anattamanā evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.47.eng: The nun so-and-so says this in anger:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.48.eng: “I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training!

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.49.eng: The Sakyan daughters are not the only monastics.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.50.pli: Santaññāpi samaṇiyo lajjiniyo kukkuccikā sikkhākāmā, tāsāhaṃ santike brahmacariyaṃ carissāmī’ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.50.eng: There are other monastics who have a sense of conscience, who are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. I’ll practice the spiritual life with them.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.51.eng: And she keeps on saying it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.52.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuniṃ samanubhāsati tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.52.eng: The Sangha presses her to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.53.pli: Yassā ayyāya khamati itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā samanubhāsanā tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya, sā tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.53.eng: Any nun who approves of pressing her to make her stop should remain silent.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.54.eng: Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.55.eng: For the second time I speak on this matter …

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.56.eng: For the third time I speak on this matter …

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.57.pli: Samanubhaṭṭhā saṅghena itthannāmā bhikkhunī tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.57.eng: The Sangha has pressed nun so-and-so to stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.58.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.58.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.59.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.59.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, an offense. Yet just below the text says that the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.60.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.61.eng: When the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.62.pli: Saṅghādisesaṃ ajjhāpajjantiyā ñattiyā dukkaṭaṃ, dvīhi kammavācāhi thullaccayā paṭippassambhanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.62.eng: For one who commits the offense entailing suspension, the offense of wrong conduct and the serious offenses are annulled.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.64.eng: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.66.pli: yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya āpajjati, na saha vatthujjhācārā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.66.eng: there is an offense when she has been pressed for the third time, not as soon as the misconduct has been committed.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.68.eng: she is sent away from the Sangha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.70.eng: … Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.2.1.pli: Dhammakamme dhammakammasaññā na paṭinissajjati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.2.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.2.2.pli: Dhammakamme vematikā na paṭinissajjati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.2.2.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.2.3.pli: Dhammakamme adhammakammasaññā na paṭinissajjati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.2.3.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.2.4.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.2.5.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.2.6.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.3.2.eng: if she has not been pressed;

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.3.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.3.6.eng: The tenth offense entailing suspension is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.3.6.comm: The Pali says the “seventh offense”, but since I am including the rules that the nuns have in common with the monks in the count, I get “tenth offense” instead. The same adjustment is required for the next three rules.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:0.4.eng: The training rule on being angry about a legal issue

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī kismiñcideva adhikaraṇe paccākatā kupitā anattamanā evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Caṇḍakāḷī was angry that she had lost a legal case, saying,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.3.pli: “chandagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo, dosagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo, mohagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo, bhayagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.3.eng: “The nuns are acting out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, and fear.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.4.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.4.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā caṇḍakāḷī kismiñcideva adhikaraṇe paccākatā kupitā anattamanā evaṃ vakkhati—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.5.eng: “How can Venerable Caṇḍakāḷī say such things just because she’s angry that she has lost a legal case?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī kismiñcideva adhikaraṇe paccākatā kupitā anattamanā evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.7.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Caṇḍakāḷī says this because she’s angry?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī kismiñcideva adhikaraṇe paccākatā kupitā anattamanā evaṃ vakkhati—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.11.eng: “How can the nun Caṇḍakāḷī say such things just because she’s angry that she has lost a legal case?

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.14.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.15.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī kismiñcideva adhikaraṇe paccākatā kupitā anattamanā evaṃ vadeyya—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.15.1.eng: ‘If a nun is angry because she has lost a legal case, saying,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.16.pli: ‘chandagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo, dosagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo, mohagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo, bhayagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo’ti,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.16.eng: “The nuns are acting out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, and fear,”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.17.eng: then the nuns should correct her like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.18.pli: ‘māyye, kismiñcideva adhikaraṇe paccākatā kupitā anattamanā evaṃ avaca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.18.eng: “Venerable, just because you’re angry that you’ve lost a legal case, don’t say,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.19.pli: chandagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo dosagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo mohagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo bhayagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.19.eng: ‘The nuns are acting out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, and fear.’

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.20.pli: Ayyā kho chandāpi gaccheyya, dosāpi gaccheyya, mohāpi gaccheyya, bhayāpi gaccheyyā’ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.20.eng: Perhaps it’s you who are acting out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, and fear.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.21.pli: Evañca sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi vuccamānā tatheva paggaṇheyya, sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsitabbā tassa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.21.eng: If that nun continues as before, the nuns should press her up to three times to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.22.pli: Yāvatatiyañce samanubhāsīyamānā taṃ paṭinissajjeyya, iccetaṃ kusalaṃ;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.22.eng: If she then stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.23.pli: no ce paṭinissajjeyya, ayampi bhikkhunī yāvatatiyakaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:1.23.eng: If she does not stop, then after the third announcement that nun too has committed an offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.6.pli: adhikaraṇaṃ nāma cattāri adhikaraṇāni— vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, kiccādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.6.eng: there are four kinds of legal issues: legal issues arising from disputes, legal issues arising from accusations, legal issues arising from offenses, legal issues arising from business.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.8.eng: what is meant is that she has been defeated.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.12.eng: “The nuns are acting out of favoritism … and fear.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.16.pli: aññāhi bhikkhunīhi. Yā passanti yā suṇanti tāhi vattabbā—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.16.eng: other nuns who see it or hear about it. They should correct her like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.17.pli: “māyye, kismiñcideva adhikaraṇe paccākatā kupitā anattamanā evaṃ avaca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.17.eng: “Venerable, just because you’re angry that you’ve lost a legal case, don’t say,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.18.eng: ‘The nuns are acting out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, and fear.’

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.19.pli: Ayyā kho chandāpi gaccheyya …pe… bhayāpi gaccheyyā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.19.eng: Perhaps it’s you who are acting out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, and fear.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.20.eng: And they should correct her a second

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.22.eng: If she stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.23.eng: If she does not stop, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.24.eng: If those who hear about it do not say anything, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.25.eng: That nun, even if she has to be pulled into the Sangha, should be corrected like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.26.pli: “māyye, kismiñcideva adhikaraṇe paccākatā kupitā anattamanā evaṃ avaca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.26.eng: “Venerable, just because you’re angry that you’ve lost a legal case, don’t say,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.27.eng: ‘The nuns are acting out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, and fear.’

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.28.pli: Ayyā kho chandāpi gaccheyya …pe… bhayāpi gaccheyyā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.28.eng: Perhaps it’s you who are acting out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, and fear.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.29.eng: They should correct her a second

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.31.eng: If she stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.32.eng: If she does not stop, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.34.eng: “And, monks, she should be pressed like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.35.eng: A competent and capable nun should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.36.pli: ‘Suṇātu me, ayye, saṅgho. Ayaṃ itthannāmā bhikkhunī kismiñcideva adhikaraṇe paccākatā kupitā anattamanā evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.36.eng: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen. The nun so-and-so, because she’s angry that she has lost a legal case, says this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.37.pli: “chandagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo… pe… bhayagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.37.eng: “The nuns are acting out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, and fear.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.38.eng: And she keeps on saying it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.39.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuniṃ samanubhāseyya tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.39.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should press her to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.41.eng: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.42.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmā bhikkhunī kismiñcideva adhikaraṇe paccākatā kupitā anattamanā evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.42.eng: The nun so-and-so, because she’s angry that she has lost a legal case, says this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.43.eng: “The nuns are acting out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, and fear.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.44.eng: And she keeps on saying it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.45.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuniṃ samanubhāsati tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.45.eng: The Sangha presses her to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.46.pli: Yassā ayyāya khamati itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā samanubhāsanā tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya, sā tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.46.eng: Any nun who approves of pressing her to make her stop should remain silent.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.47.eng: Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.48.eng: For the second time I speak on this matter …

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.49.eng: For the third time I speak on this matter …

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.50.pli: Samanubhaṭṭhā saṅghena itthannāmā bhikkhunī tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.50.eng: The Sangha has pressed nun so-and-so to stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.51.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.51.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.52.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.52.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, an offense. Yet just below the text says that the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.53.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.54.eng: When the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.55.eng: For one who commits the offense entailing suspension, the offense of wrong conduct

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.56.eng: and the serious offenses are annulled.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.58.eng: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.60.pli: yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya āpajjati, na saha vatthujjhācārā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.60.eng: there is an offense when she has been pressed for the third time, not as soon as the misconduct has been committed.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.62.eng: she is sent away from the Sangha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.1.64.eng: … Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.2.1.pli: Dhammakamme dhammakammasaññā na paṭinissajjati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.2.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.2.2.pli: Dhammakamme vematikā na paṭinissajjati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.2.2.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.2.3.pli: Dhammakamme adhammakammasaññā na paṭinissajjati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.2.3.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.2.4.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.2.5.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.2.6.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.3.2.eng: if she has not been pressed;

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.3.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss11:2.3.6.eng: The eleventh offense entailing suspension is finished.
